title: BARN Challenge in MuJoCo
text:
This repository enables evaluation of a controller for the BARN challenge in python using MuJoCo for simulation.



Screen grab


The BARN Challenge is a competition involving navigation through a cluttered environment using a 2D LiDAR sensor. The competition requires using the Robot Operating System (ROS) or Gazebo. Both frameworks require too much up-front investment before you can even test a simple controller. This repository lets you test ideas quickly using python and MuJoCo. The two things that needed to be done are:

Define a LiDAR sensor for MuJoCo (surprisingly not done already).
Convert the .world files meant for Gazebo simulation to .xml files compatible with MuJoCo.

title: LiDAR robot
text:
This project worked on building a mobile robot using relatively easy-to-source parts together with minimal 3D printing (Link to OpenSCAD files). The robot uses a simple RPLiDAR for feedback1.
The chassis uses spacers and 3D printing. The robot combines a Raspberry Pi 4 for sensor processing with an ESP32-s3 for motor control. The Raspberry Pi uses python and sends commands using pyserial to the ESP32-s3. The ESP32-s3 was programmed in C using the esp-idf development framework.
